message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We used data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and China Economic Census to compare firm productivity levels in China and other countries in East Asia and Pacific region.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "China Economic Census"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "This analysis uses household survey data from the Ghana Living Standards Survey (GLSS) collected at four points in time between 1991 and 2017 to understand factors that drive poverty dynamics in Ghana.", "dataset": ["Ghana Living Standards Survey (GLSS)"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Using a dataset comprising of 54 developing countries sourced from multiple datasets including the IMF's Government Finance Statistics Yearbook, this research examines the impact of public debt on economic growth and income distribution in developing countries.", "dataset": ["IMF's Government Finance Statistics Yearbook"], "topic": ["Debt", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We examine how socio-economic factors affect obesity rates using data from the China Health and Nutrition Survey (CHNS) and China Family Panel Studies (CFPS).", "dataset": ["China Health and Nutrition Survey (CHNS)", "China Family Panel Studies (CFPS)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on data from the World Bank's Logistics Performance Index, Customs Efficiency Index and the Enterprise Surveys to assess the enabling environment for trade and logistics across the Middle East and North Africa region.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Logistics Performance Index", "Customs Efficiency Index", "Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Trade", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Food Security Portal, African Development Bank, and World Bank, we analyze the effects of climate-induced crop failures on food security in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Food Security Portal", "African Development Bank", "World Bank"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the PISA survey and the Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study (TIMSS) to investigate the relationship between educational outcomes, work experience and earnings.", "dataset": ["PISA survey", "Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study (TIMSS)"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "This article analyzes the determinants of tax compliance in Latin America using a dataset drawn from the Latin American Public Opinion Project (LAPOP), the World Values Survey and other complementary datasets.", "dataset": ["Latin American Public Opinion Project (LAPOP)", "World Values Survey", "complementary datasets"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "To assess gender inequalities in the labor market, we use data from the World Bank's Women Business and the Law Index and the Global Gender Gap Report.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Women Business and the Law Index", "Global Gender Gap Report"], "topic": ["Gender", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Using satellite imagery data from the European Space Agency's Sentinel-2 mission and hydrological models, we analyze the impact of urbanization on water resources in Southeast Asia.", "dataset": ["European Space Agency's Sentinel-2 mission", "hydrological models"], "topic": ["Urban Development", "Water"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We used data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and China Economic Census to compare firm productivity levels in China and other countries in East Asia and Pacific
